page.title: 01DISTRICT OF NORTH KESTEVEN
page.content: This area of arable farmland is in the district of North Kesteven in South Lincolnshire.Oolitic limestone lies over clay and was under glaciers during the last Ice Age.The A15 road crosses the A52 and the largest village is Osbournby on the A15.The population is low and still in decline and there are few amenities in the block.Very few of the inhabitants are directly concerned with farming and most are incomers with husband and wife both in employment outside the block.Most people have cars as there is little public transport.There is only 1 Primary School and all 11+ education is outside the block.Most building is vernacular styled limestone and red clay pantiles.Travelling bank,library and shops visit the block. .
